required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Protein Supplementation of Snakehead Fish Cookies on Pregnant Women
clinical_study.official_title: Protein Supplementation of Snakehead Fish Cookies on Pregnant Women to Prevent Intrauterine Growth Restriction and Low Birth Weight in Sleman District, Yogyakarta Province, Indonesia: a Randomized Controlled Trial Study

brief_summary.textblock:
This study was randomized controlled trial study whose subjects were pregnant women in Sleman District, Yogyakarta, Indonesia. The aims of this study were to make snakehead fish cookies formula which can be well accepted by pregnant women and to observed its effect on fetal growth and birth weight and length. It was hypothesized that snakehead fish cookies could prevent intrauterine fetal growth (IUGR) and low birth weight (LBW).
Subjects on this study were randomly allocated into two groups which were treatment and control group. Subjects in treatment group were given snakehead fish cookies, while subject in control group received standard cookies. The intervention period lasted until subjects delivered their babies.

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects were enrolled from Public Health Center (puskesmas) in Sleman District, Yogyakarta Province, Indonesia. Subjects were being explained about the study intervention and were given informed consent as an approval of joining this study. The intervention was given everyday as much as 75g cookies for several weeks period (until delivery). Examination on fetal growth was done every month for each subjects. Birth weight and length were collected after delivery from child health book record.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline EFW after 1 month
primary_outcome.description: We measured EFW monthly using 2D ultrasonography (USG) for each subjects

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline BPD after 1 month
primary_outcome.description: We measured BPD monthly using 2D ultrasonography (USG) for each subjects

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline AC after 1 month
primary_outcome.description: We measured AC monthly using 2D ultrasonography (USG) for each subjects

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline FL after 1 month
primary_outcome.description: We measured FL monthly using 2D ultrasonography (USG) for each subjects

primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after the baby is born
immediately after the baby is born

arm_group.description: Subjects who were given intervention of snakehead fish cookies during the study period
Subjects who were in control group and received standard cookies

intervention.description: Either snakehead fish cookies or standard cookies were given to subjects 75g per day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. second and third trimester gestational age,
2. lower-class family with income under Sleman District minimum wage in 2019 (< 1,701,000 Rupiah),
3. pregnant women of under 25 years old, and
4. high school graduate or below
Exclusion Criteria:
1. suffering from anemia,
2. experiencing preeclampsia,
3. having multiple gestational, and
4. allergic to fish, eggs, and chocolate.

facility.name: Public Health Center (Puskesmas) in the area of Sleman District

patient_data.ipd_description: This research was supported by Ministry of Health of Indonesia, and all data collected in this study were subject to Indonesian Ministry of Health rights.
